item.title: 美联储暂停量化宽松政策，财政部债务计划或为美债带来短暂宽松
item.description: 美联储缩减资产负债表的速度可能放缓，财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）也保证不会立即增加长期债务，这些都能在短期内缓解债券市场对财政问题的担忧。【原文：A potential slowdown of the Federal Reserve's balance sheet drawdown and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's assurance against imminent long-term debt hikes could offer relief in the near term to bond market jitters as fiscal concerns linger.】

item.title: 优步首席执行官科斯罗萨西支持特朗普推动取消小费税
item.description: 优步（Uber）首席执行官达拉-科斯罗萨希（Dara Khosrowshahi）周五表示，他和优步都支持美国总统唐纳德-特朗普提出的取消对优步司机收取小费征税的倡议。【原文：Uber's CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said on Friday that both he and the ride-hailing firm are supportive of U.S. President Donald Trump's initiative to eliminate taxes on tips received by its drivers.】

item.title: Waze 成为欧盟技术规则下的大型平台，色情网站将被除名
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的地图应用 Waze 在达到欧盟技术规则规定的关键用户数量后，需要采取更多措施来处理其平台上的非法网络内容，而三家成人内容网站在用户数量低于门槛后，可能会面临较宽松的要求。【原文：Alphabet's mapping app Waze needs to do more to tackle illegal online content on its platform after hitting a key user number under EU tech rules, while three adult content sites will likely face less stringent requirements after their user numbers fell below the threshold.】

item.title: 解说员：禽流感如何导致美国鸡蛋价格飞涨
item.description: 由于禽流感爆发导致数百万只母鸡死亡，造成鸡蛋短缺，美国食品杂货店的鸡蛋价格攀升至历史新高，几乎比一年前翻了一番。【原文：The price of eggs at U.S. grocery stores has climbed to a record high, nearly doubling from a year ago, as outbreaks of bird flu have led to shortages by wiping out millions of hens.】

item.title: 美国众议院关注美联储的新工作组召开首次会议
item.description: 由一个对美国中央银行制定货币政策的方法持批评态度的强大委员会的负责人成立的一个新的国会特别工作组已将其首次公开听证会安排在下月初举行。【原文：A new congressional task force focused on the Federal Reserve, set up by the head of a powerful committee who is critical of the U.S. central bank's approach to setting monetary policy, has penciled in its first public hearing for early next month.】

item.title: 白宫希望乌克兰尽快签署重要的矿产协议
item.description: 白宫国家安全顾问迈克-华尔兹（Mike Waltz）周五表示，他期待乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）与美国签署一项矿产协议，作为结束乌克兰战争努力的一部分。【原文：White House national security adviser Mike Waltz said on Friday he expects Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to sign a minerals agreement with the United States as part of efforts to end the Ukraine war, while President Donald Trump said Kyiv has no cards to play with.】

item.title: 贝克休斯称美国油气钻机数升至 6 月以来最高水平
item.description: 能源服务公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周五在其密切关注的报告中称，美国能源公司本周连续第四周增加石油和天然气钻机，达到自 6 月份以来的最高水平。【原文：U.S. energy firms this week added oil and natural gas rigs for a fourth week in a row to the highest level since June, energy services firm Baker Hughes said in its closely followed report on Friday.】

item.title: 加拿大央行行长希望审查维持 2% 的通胀目标不变
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee 和 David Ljunggren【原文：By Promit Mukherjee and David Ljunggren】

item.title: 康菲石油公司将以 7.35 亿美元的价格向壳牌出售在乌尔萨和欧罗巴油田的权益
item.description: 康菲石油公司周五表示，将以 7.35 亿美元的价格向壳牌出售其在厄萨油田和欧罗巴油田的权益。【原文：ConocoPhillips said on Friday it would sell its interests in the Ursa and Europa Fields to Shell for $735 million.】

item.title: 美联储杰斐逊称人工智能正加速投资者对央行官员信息的反应
item.description: 美联储副主席菲利普-杰斐逊（Philip Jefferson）周五表示，人工智能正在加快投资者对央行行长讲话中的具体句子以及描述其政策行动的声明做出反应的速度，但目前还不清楚这种速度的加快是促进还是阻碍了货币政策的有效传导。【原文：Artificial intelligence is speeding the rate at which investors react to specific sentences in central bankers' speeches and in statements describing their policy actions, Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said on Friday, but it's unclear whether that increased speed is boosting or hindering the effective transmission of monetary policy.】

item.title: 文件显示，特斯拉即将进入印度市场，印度将为电动汽车充电投资设置关税减免上限
item.description: 一份政府文件显示，印度的电动汽车政策为在该国投资的外国汽车制造商提供进口税减免，但将限制他们将用于充电基础设施的资金用于减免，从而增加他们的汽车制造量。【原文：India's EV policy, which offers import tax cuts for foreign automakers investing in the country, will restrict them from using funds spent on charging infrastructure for such relief, increasing their car manufacturing, a government document shows.】

item.title: 高盛称股市可能面临调整
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）专家斯科特-鲁布纳（Scott Rubner）在周五路透社看到的一份周四报告中说，由于期权市场的混乱，华尔街股市可能面临调整。【原文：Wall Street stocks could be facing a correction because of ructions in the options market, Goldman Sachs specialist Scott Rubner said in a Thursday note seen by Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 普京称俄罗斯应加快锂矿开采计划
item.description: 俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）周五表示，俄罗斯应加快开采锂矿藏和稀土等其他重要矿产的计划，锂矿藏是生产高容量电动电池的关键金属。【原文：President Vladimir Putin said on Friday that Russia should speed up plans to mine its deposits of lithium, a metal crucial for the production of high-capacity electric batteries, and other critical minerals, including rare earths.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，谷歌面临欧盟违反 DMA 规则的指控
item.description: 据直接知情人士透露，欧盟反垄断监管机构将指控 Alphabet 旗下谷歌公司违反了欧盟旨在遏制大科技公司权力的规定，因为谷歌提出的搜索结果修改方案未能解决监管机构及其竞争对手的担忧。【原文：EU antitrust regulators are set to charge Alphabet unit Google with breaching EU rules aimed at checking the power of Big Tech after proposed changes to its search results failed to address their concerns and those of their rivals, people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 受关税担忧影响，2 月份美国消费者信心指数骤降
item.description: 2 月份美国消费者信心降幅超过预期，创下 15 个月以来的新低，通胀预期急剧升温，原因是美国家庭担心唐纳德-特朗普总统的大幅、广泛关税计划将削弱他们的购买力。【原文：U.S. consumer sentiment dropped more than expected in February to a 15-month low and inflation expectations rocketed as households worried that President Donald Trump's plans for steep and broad-based tariffs would eat into their purchasing power.】

item.title: 特朗普顾问称期待泽伦斯基签署矿产协议
item.description: 白宫国家安全顾问迈克-华尔兹（Mike Waltz）周五表示，他期待乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）与美国签署矿产协议，作为结束乌克兰战争努力的一部分。【原文：White House national security adviser Mike Waltz said on Friday he expects Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to sign a minerals agreement with the United States as part of efforts to end the Ukraine war.】

item.title: 苹果在英国取消端到端云加密功能
item.description: 苹果公司周五在一份声明中表示，苹果公司无法再在英国提供其最先进的端到端云数据加密安全功能。【原文：Apple can no longer offer its most advanced, end-to-end encrypted security feature for cloud data in the UK, the iPhone maker said in a statement on Friday.】

item.title: 美国 1 月成屋销售降幅超预期
item.description: 由于高抵押贷款利率和房价抑制了需求，美国现房销售在连续三个月增长后，1 月份的降幅超出预期。【原文：U.S. existing home sales dropped more than expected in January after three straight monthly increases as high mortgage rates and house prices stifled demand.】

item.title: 尽管出资人反对，英国法院还是批准了万事达卡和解协议
item.description: 万事达卡（Mastercard）就代表英国消费者提起的一项具有里程碑意义的诉讼达成的和解协议周五获得了伦敦一家法庭的批准，尽管为该诉讼提供资金的公司提出了反对意见。【原文：Mastercard's agreement to settle a landmark lawsuit brought on behalf of British consumers was approved by a London tribunal on Friday, despite opposition from the firm that funded the litigation.】

item.title: 消息人士称，刚果铜矿交易陷入僵局，中国诺林科提高竞标难度
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，中国北方工业公司（Norinco）已提出调整其收购Chemaf SA所拥有的铜和钴资产的报价，提高刚果政府的持股比例，以使交易顺利进行。【原文：China North Industries Corp, known as Norinco, has offered to adjust its offer to buy copper and cobalt assets owned by Chemaf SA by raising the Congo government's stake to smooth the path to a deal, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 巴西 Azul 公司批准利用尼勒曼投资增资
item.description: 巴西 Azul 航空公司周四晚些时候表示，作为庭外重组的一部分，该公司董事会已批准增资，让出租人以股权代替近 5.5 亿美元的债务。【原文：Brazilian airline Azul's board of directors has approved a capital increase as part of an out-of-court restructuring that gave lessors equity in lieu of nearly $550 million in obligations, the company said late on Thursday.】

item.title: 关税、联邦政府削减开支抑制美国商业活动
item.description: 由于对进口商品征收关税和联邦政府大幅削减开支的担忧日益加剧，2 月份美国商业活动几乎停滞，唐纳德-特朗普总统赢得大选后取得的所有收益都被抹去。【原文：U.S. business activity nearly stalled in February amid mounting fears over tariffs on imports and deep cuts in federal government spending, erasing all the gains notched in the aftermath of President Donald Trump's election victory.】

item.title: Stellantis 在英国就安全气囊和安全带卡特尔提起的 8.07 亿美元诉讼被驳回
item.description: 周五，伦敦一家法庭驳回了 Stellantis 公司对两家安全设备制造商提出的 7.71 亿欧元（8.0762 亿美元）的诉讼。【原文：Stellantis' 771 million euro ($807.62 million) lawsuit against two safety equipment makers was dismissed by a London tribunal on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称美国向伊拉克施压要求恢复库尔德石油出口
item.description: 八位直接了解此事的消息人士告诉路透社，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的政府正在向伊拉克施加压力，要求伊拉克允许库尔德人重新开始石油出口，否则将与伊朗一起面临制裁。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is piling pressure on Iraq to allow Kurdish oil exports to restart or face sanctions alongside Iran, eight sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 FDA 称诺和诺德减肥药短缺问题已解决
item.description: 美国食品和药物管理局网站周五显示，丹麦制药商诺和诺德公司广受欢迎的减肥药和糖尿病药物Wegovy和Ozempic的短缺问题已经解决。【原文：A shortage of Danish drugmaker Novo Nordisk's popular weight-loss and diabetes drugs, Wegovy and Ozempic, has been resolved, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration's website showed on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，作为乌克兰战争解决方案的一部分，俄罗斯可能让出 3,000 亿美元的冻结资产
item.description: 三位消息人士告诉路透社，俄罗斯可能同意将冻结在欧洲的 3,000 亿美元主权资产用于乌克兰重建，但将坚持把部分资金用于莫斯科军队控制的乌克兰五分之一领土。【原文：Russia could agree to using $300 billion of sovereign assets frozen in Europe for reconstruction in Ukraine but will insist that part of the money is spent on the one-fifth of the country that Moscow's forces control, three sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 消息人士称，人工智能初创公司 Genspark 融资 1 亿美元，欲与谷歌竞争
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，搜索初创公司 Genspark 在 A 轮融资中筹集了 1 亿美元，估值达 5.3 亿美元。【原文：Search startup Genspark has raised $100 million in a series A funding round, valuing the startup at $530 million, according to a source familiar with the matter, as the race to use artificial intelligence to disrupt Google’s stranglehold on the search engine market heats up.】

item.title: 摩根大通分析师认为阿美今年不会派发特别股息
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan）周五在一份研究报告中表示，沙特阿美石油公司（Saudi Aramco）预计今年将不派发与业绩挂钩的股息，而在此之前的 2024 年现金周期将更加平衡。【原文：Saudi Aramco is forecast to have no performance-linked dividend this year after a more balanced 2024 cash cycle following earlier bumper results that backed the special payout, JPMorgan said in a research note on Friday.】

item.title: Holcim 北美业务分拆后将更名为 Amrize
item.description: 瑞士 Holcim 公司周五表示，已将其北美建材公司命名为 Amrize，并计划于今年上市。【原文：Holcim has given the name Amrize to its North American building materials company, which it plans to list this year, the Swiss firm said on Friday.】

item.title: 当地新闻报道称，Equinor 计划出售阿根廷陆上资产
item.description: Mas Energia》在线刊物援引未具名消息人士的话报道，挪威石油天然气公司埃奎诺（Equinor）正寻求出售其在阿根廷瓦卡穆埃尔塔地区的陆上资产。【原文：Norwegian oil and gas firm Equinor is looking to sell its onshore assets in Argentina's Vaca Muerta region, the Mas Energia online publication reported, citing unnamed sources.】
